1494.verse: أُوْلَـٰٓئِكَ|Those|82|96|51$ٱلَّذِينَ|(are) the ones who|148|177|20$خَسِرُوٓاْ|(have) lost|93|122|5453$أَنفُسَهُمْ|their souls,|93|122|87$وَضَلَّ|and lost|77|106|5499$عَنْهُم|from them|87|102|2643$مَّا|(is) what|80|183|262$كَانُواْ|they used|86|292|94$يَفْتَرُونَ|(to) invent.|97|200|2726$

1496.verse: إِنَّ|Indeed,|70|80|58$ٱلَّذِينَ|those who|89|108|20$ءَامَنُواْ|believe|82|101|84$وَعَمِلُواْ|and do|92|111|238$ٱلصَّـٰلِحَـٰتِ|good deeds|122|141|239$وَأَخْبَتُوٓاْ|and humble themselves|174|184|8428$إِلَىٰ|before|62|72|118$رَبِّهِمْ|their Lord,|88|108|54$أُوْلَـٰٓئِكَ|those|82|102|51$أَصْحَـٰبُ|(are the) companions|162|182|409$ٱلْجَنَّةِ‌ۖ|(of) Paradise,|110|130|778$هُمْ|they|50|70|49$فِيهَا|in it|54|64|253$خَـٰلِدُونَ|(will) abide forever.|149|149|257$

1497.verse: ۞ مَثَلُ|(The) example|115|129|1869$ٱلْفَرِيقَيْنِ|(of) the two parties|152|180|5775$كَٱلْأَعْمَىٰ|(is) like the blind|130|158|8429$وَٱلْأَصَمِّ|and the deaf,|110|138|8430$وَٱلْبَصِيرِ|and the seer|107|121|8431$وَٱلسَّمِيعِ‌ۚ|and the hearer.|123|150|8432$هَلْ|Are|50|104|1829$يَسْتَوِيَانِ|they equal|99|152|8433$مَثَلاً‌ۚ|(in) comparison?|129|182|261$أَفَلَا|Then, will not|110|137|452$تَذَكَّرُونَ|you take heed?|122|122|6186$

1501.verse: قَالَ|He said,|73|80|309$يَـٰقَوْمِ|"O my people!|112|126|513$أَرَءَيْتُمْ|Do you see|94|108|5597$إِن|if|44|58|225$كُنتُ|I was|64|78|4182$عَلَىٰ|on|63|77|52$بَيِّنَةٍ|(the) clear proof|130|144|5648$مِّن|from|50|57|53$رَّبِّى|my Lord,|77|85|2902$وَءَاتَـٰنِى|while He has given me|167|183|8441$رَحْمَةً|mercy|78|94|2636$مِّنْ|from|50|66|53$عِندِهِۦ|Himself|77|93|7654$فَعُمِّيَتْ|but (it) has been obscured|198|206|8442$عَلَيْكُمْ|from you,|83|95|416$أَنُلْزِمُكُمُوهَا|should We compel you (to accept) it|264|288|8443$وَأَنتُمْ|while you (are)|120|144|211$لَهَا كَـٰرِهُونَ|averse to it?|137|149|8444$

1493.verse: Those were not causing failure [to Allah] on earth, nor did they have besides Allah any protectors. For them the punishment will be multiplied. They were not able to hear, nor did they see.

1494.verse: Those are the ones who will have lost themselves, and lost from them is what they used to invent.

1495.verse: Assuredly, it is they in the Hereafter who will be the greatest losers.

1496.verse: Indeed, they who have believed and done righteous deeds and humbled themselves to their Lord - those are the companions of Paradise; they will abide eternally therein.

1497.verse: The example of the two parties is like the blind and deaf, and the seeing and hearing. Are they equal in comparison? Then, will you not remember?

1498.verse: And We had certainly sent Noah to his people, [saying], "Indeed, I am to you a clear warner

1499.verse: That you not worship except Allah. Indeed, I fear for you the punishment of a painful day."

1500.verse: So the eminent among those who disbelieved from his people said, "We do not see you but as a man like ourselves, and we do not see you followed except by those who are the lowest of us [and] at first suggestion. And we do not see in you over us any merit; rather, we think you are liars."

1501.verse: He said, "O my people have you considered: if I should be upon clear evidence from my Lord while He has given me mercy from Himself but it has been made unapparent to you, should we force it upon you while you are averse to it?
